page.title: 04A.DROME(DIS)EEC GRAIN STOR
page.content: Bitteswell Aerodrome was vacated by British Aerospace in 1983.The biggest aeroplane which ever landed there was a Boeing 737.The site covers 500 acres There are twelve hangars on the site each measuring 240 feet by 120 feet.The owner is currently {transferring aeroplanes}from a site in Surrey to the aerodrome and this must be completed by October 1985. Six of the hangars are now used for storing grain.This is grown in the Eastern Counties of England and stored for use in E.E.C Countries.Each hangar contains approx 11,000 tons. The grain is only stored for one year.
